The plant typically grows in alpine meadows at high elevations, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and the plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Meconopsis lamjungensis is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
